The morning sun cast long shadows across the empty parking lot as Maria pulled her coat tighter against the cold. She had arrived thirty minutes early, a habit from her days working at the factory downtown. The interview was scheduled for nine, but she wanted time to collect her thoughts.

After fifteen years in manufacturing, the transition to office work felt daunting. Her daughter had helped update her resume, adding words like "stakeholder" and "cross-functional" that still felt foreign on her tongue. But she had learned harder things before.

The glass doors of the building reflected her nervous smile back at her. Whatever happened today, at least she had tried.
